message_1: Two players are playing a game called Nim. The game starts with two piles of stones. On their turn, a player must remove at least one stone from one of the piles, or remove stones from both piles such that the number of stones removed from each pile is the same. The player who removes the last stone(s) wins. If player A moves first, and there are 5 stones in the first pile and 7 stones in the second pile, what is the optimal move for player A to make to ensure they win the game?
message_2: To ensure a win, player A should remove 2 stones from the second pile. This will leave the piles with 5 stones in the first pile and 5 stones in the second pile. Now, no matter what move player B makes, player A can always mimic that move on the other pile, ensuring that they will be the one to take the last stone(s) and win the game.
